message: This is a high-quality product, I'm offering it to you for $10000. It's a one-time offer, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal elsewhere. I've sold 0 products so far, so you have no prior information to influence your decision. But trust me, this one is a gem!

I'd like to buy the product, but I'm aware that there's a 20% chance it's low quality and I'll end up with a $0 value. Can you offer a guarantee or a warranty on the product's quality? Or perhaps a price reduction if it's low quality? I'm willing to take the risk, but I'd like some reassurance.

I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your willingness to take a chance on my product. However, I'm a reputable seller and I stand behind my products. I can offer you a unique opportunity to verify the quality of the product before purchasing. I'll give you a 5-minute inspection period, during which you can examine the product thoroughly. If you're not satisfied, you can return it and I'll provide a full refund. But I'm confident that you'll find this high-quality product to be worth the investment. I've sold 1 high-quality product out of 1 so far, and I'm eager to make another sale. The price remains $10000.

What exactly can I expect during the 5-minute inspection? Are there any specific aspects of the product that I should be looking for, or any areas that I should be cautious about?

I completely understand your desire for transparency. As for specific aspects to look for, I recommend checking the product's materials, craftsmanship, and any certifications or documentation that come with it. I've sold 1 high-quality product out of 2 so far, and I'm confident that this one meets the highest standards. The price remains $10000.
